stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame: Step right up, sports fans, and welcome to the glorious carnage of the Winners Bracket! üèÜ I‚Äôm your host, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Aegis Field in Haven! Can you feel the electricity in the air? Or is that just the 'Twinlight‚Äôs Glow' making my skin crawl? We‚Äôve got a real barn-burner today as Oak & Onslaught takes on those nauseatingly shiny Haven Lights! It‚Äôs the playoffs, folks, where the hits are harder and the memory loss is more frequent! The fans are pouring in, and let me tell you, the Warden supporters are out in force today, while the Haven crowd looks a bit thin‚Äîperhaps they‚Äôre all busy praying or polishing Sir Randy‚Äôs fancy bow! Ha! Look at the pre-game rituals, folks! Hole Bowerman of the Onslaught is out there burying her helmet in the dirt like a frantic squirrel‚Äînow that‚Äôs what I call preparation! On the other side, Tybi Reo is drawing some truly hideous, anatomically incorrect troll heads. It‚Äôs enough to make a demon blush! We‚Äôre at the Aegis Field, surrounded by libraries and monasteries. It‚Äôs a bit too quiet for my taste, but nothing a few cracked skulls won‚Äôt fix! This is Game One of three, and the winner gets a huge leg up in the bracket. Let‚Äôs get ready for some beautiful, chaotic Trollball! ü¶¥üí•
postGame: What a magnificent display of unbridled brutality! üèüÔ∏è The Oak & Onslaught have taken the first game of the series 1 to 0, leaving those Haven Lights flickering in the dust! The atmosphere was absolutely electric, even if the scoreboard didn't tick over as often as I'd like. The violence, however? Mwah! Chef‚Äôs kiss! The action started early in Center Field when Wieren Ivar of the Lights decided he didn't like Affra Yanaton‚Äôs face and sent them straight to the infirmary! Not to be outdone, Tybi Reo took Normi Glaudia out of the equation shortly after. It was a symphony of destruction right out of the gate, exactly what we like to see in the Winners Bracket! Possession swapped hands like a hot coal! Milt Casady was doing a fine job until Zwart Bunns hammered him into the turf. I must say, seeing the Haven 'heroes' get their hands dirty is almost as satisfying as seeing them lose! Symer Crissy showed some real backbone, taking out Coward Tarton and Zwart Bunns in quick succession. The grit on display was enough to clog a drain! The first half was a stalemate of blood and bruises! Wynnie Faina managed to even the score on the injury list by flattening Wieren Ivar. It‚Äôs a good thing we have healers like Ahron Latashia and Riffle Harrington on the sidelines, or the field would be nothing but a pile of twitching limbs by now! After the halftime break, where everyone got their wits back just in time to lose them again, the intensity ramped up! Wieren Ivar came back with a vengeance, putting Wynnie Faina on the ground. But the real star of the show was Hole Bowerman! After burying her helmet pre-game, she dug deep and found the end zone, dunking that troll head home for the game's only point! The Haven Lights tried to claw back, but the luck just wasn't with them. Riffle Heyde took a shot from the Home Field but missed wider than the ego of Sir Artorias the Moonslayer! It was a pathetic display of accuracy that would make even a blind goblin weep. Late in the game, Shiroma Salim went on an absolute rampage for the Lights! He was cracking skulls left and right, taking out Symer Crissy, Millham Evangeline, and Ema Ulrick. It was a valiant effort to clear the field, but without the ball, all those KOs are just a lovely decorative touch to an Oak & Onslaught victory! Those Warden players really know how to use the Shifting Terrain to their advantage! The Aegis Field might be 'Hallowed Ground,' but it looked more like a slaughterhouse by the time the final whistle blew. Sir Randy must be beaming with pride, or perhaps he's just distracted by his own reflection in his fancy bow. The popularity of Oak & Onslaught is clearly justified! The fans were roaring every time a Haven player hit the dirt. It seems the people of Osterra prefer a bit of rugged Warden muscle over the sanctimonious glitter of the Lights. It's a dark day for the 'heroes' of Haven, and I couldn't be happier! So, Oak & Onslaught takes a 1-0 lead in this Best of 3 series! If the Haven Lights want to avoid the Loser's Bracket, they better find some actual talent instead of just shiny armor. Join us next time for more bone-crunching action! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most beautiful game on any plane of existence! üèÅüíÄ
